channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: China's December factory activity growth misses expectations as analysts decry insufficient stimulus
item.description: China's factory activity expanded for a third straight month in December, but growth slowed and also missed Reuters' poll expectations.

item.title: My friend has a dependent son, 32, who drives without car insurance. Would his parents be criminally liable if he has an accident?
item.description: “They declare him as a dependent for tax purposes.”

item.title: Patents and new EV’s have these small caps perking

item.title: South Korea's impeached President Yoon faces arrest as court issues warrant, deepening political turmoil
item.description: A warrant for South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol was approved by a Seoul court on Tuesday. Yoon is the first sitting South Korean president to face ...

item.title: My mother is giving my son $100K for a down payment. Can she wait until the last minute to put the money in his account?
item.description: “She really doesn’t want to send it to them until they’re ready to make the purchase.”

item.title: Jeju Air plane crash raises questions about concrete wall at the end of the runway
item.description: Some aviation experts say the damage could have been minimized had the plane not collided with the concrete wall.

item.title: Stock futures tick lower as S&P 500 closes out second year in a row with 20% gain: Live updates
item.description: The S&P has surged more than 24% this year, on pace for its second consecutive annual gain above 20%.

item.title: Jeju Air crash: Boeing shares fall after South Korea orders 737-800 inspection
item.description: Uncertainty surrounds the exact circumstances of the crash, which killed 179 of 181 people on board the flight on Sunday.

item.title: Asia-Pacific markets mostly lower after China manufacturing growth misses expectations
item.description: The country's official purchasing managers' index for December came in at 50.1, data released by the National Bureau of Statistics data showed.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield logs sharpest drop in a month to kick off holiday-shortened week
item.description: Bond yields fell sharply ahead of New Year’s Eve, after concerns about sticky inflation had pushed benchmark yields to the highest since late May.

item.description: Natural-gas prices soared on Monday, tallying their biggest percentage-point gain in nearly three years.

item.title: Last Madoff victim fund payout brings recovery to nearly 94% of Ponzi scheme losses, DOJ says
item.description: More than 40,000 victims lost billions of dollars to Bernie Madoff, whose Ponzi scheme has been called the largest in the world.

item.title: Stocks are skipping the ‘Santa Claus rally’ again this year. That doesn’t bode well for January.
item.description: Santa Claus is leaving investors in the lurch once again in 2024 as U.S. stocks have struggled during the typically bullish home stretch of the year.

item.title: Want to invest in weight loss drugs? Here’s where UBS thinks they’re headed in 2025
item.description: UBS expects that BioPharma "will find it difficult to outperform against a more uncertain macro backdrop," in the short-to medium-term.

item.title: Boeing 737-800, the model that crashed in South Korea, is one of the world's most popular aircraft
item.description: Accident investigators are trying to find the cause of a Jeju Air fatal crash landing that killed 179 of the 181 on board the flight.

item.title: Jimmy Carter quotes: 'I could have wiped Iran off the map'
item.description: "I could have wiped Iran off the map," Jimmy Carter told CNBC in 2014. Memorable quotes from the 39th president.
